page.title: 03THE AREA'S HISTORY
page.content: St.Mary's Church Comberton is part of our local history.The present vicar is the Rev.R.Stephenson.The register of baptisms dates from the year 1564.The registers of marriges dates from the year 1560 and the burials from 1561. In 1925 there were two pubs. One was named the 'Tailors Arms'.The other was named the 'Red Lion'.There was one wheelwright and one undertaker.There was also a cycle maker. There is an old dove cote in South Street.It was designed and built by Peter Frost in the 1700's. The village of Toft was founded by the Danes in the ninth century.The word Toft is a Danish word meaning homestead or field. Some people think that the name Comberton is named after Cumbras Farm, but others think it is named after the Cumbrians.{
